text:
you hide it and secretly make these moves for something I had earmarked for something else.
We had a plan to move money regularly that we agreed to. I noted several times I do not do that to the BofA account because it would screw you.
Your retort was to show me Safeway grocery charges were mine, and I confirmed they were.
If you somehow think $250 equals the $25k you just moved without so much as a peep you were doing it, we have an issue. The bigger problem is you
are doing this intentionally now with forethought and malice after I asked for a heads-up.
Why are you doing this, given we had an agreed-on solution, and I asked you to work with me instead of doing it secretly? As always, we had a plan to
ensure BofA would be funded. Yet you moved 25k without so much as a peep to me.
This creates yet another huge trust issue. To repeat myself from last week, how would you feel if I moved huge sums of money out of BofA when you
were trying to pay bills? You asked me not to do that, and while I bought groceries, I don't.
Please advise, as the entire discussion is in OFW. I am truly baffled at this intentional deception.
Message 3108 of 4024
Are you stealing from us? We just had this discussion Wed, yet today you took another $16k.
That's $26k in less than a week, and after we discussed working together in this thread below.
What's going on? Why are you doing this intentionally, knowing it causes issues when you do?

Afford me the same courtesy I give you.
I have never said no or made it difficult.
But you insist on deceiving me, always.
I don’t get your end game. Can’t we partner?
